moves.1... e6 2. e4 c5: Lets try to transpose to a Sicilian
moves.3. Nf3: dxc6 is I think better, but rare
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Bd3 Nc6 6. Be3: This Bd3 and Be3 set-up is not common...
moves.6... d5: so let's challange the center exd5 Nxd5 and white's position is structural miserable
moves.7. Nxc6: ?! exchanging knights on c6 is worst for white as my pawn centre will became overwhelming
moves.10. Nc3 d4: gaining space and two pawns on account of white's misplacements
moves.11. Ne2: needed as both Nb1 pr Na4 are worst
moves.13... cxb2: now this pawn will be a central strategic focal point, as white's need to defend it will cramp their pieces
moves.14. Rb1: tying the rook to the defence of the promotion threat
moves.14... Bd6: two ideas here h2 and Be5 controlling the long diagonal
moves.15. f4: ! to support e5, but even the black has Bc5+ to remove from the threat with tempo, I only need to be careful after Kh1
moves.15... Rb8: better than Ba3 were it can be contested by Qa4 double attack on c6 and Ba3
moves.16... Bc5+: the open g1-a7 diagonal gives me an escape route removing the bishop from the fork with tempo...
moves.17. Kh1: maybe better was 16.Kh1 to set black a trap and then 17.e5
moves.18. Qa4 O-O: Setting a trap as Qxc6 leads to Bb7 aimed against g2, and b2 is tactically protected
moves.19. Rfd1 Rd8 20. Qxc6: ?? the sacrifice of the pawn is beneficial to black as the h1-a8 diagonal is now open
moves.20... Bb7: and both my bishops are now aimed against the opponents king
moves.21. Qa4 Qh4: bringing the queen to the fight near white's king
moves.23... Qe3: tying the knight to the defence of f4
moves.24. Rgd1: I need to have caution against some tactics such as 1.Rxb2 Rxb2 2.Bh7+ ... 3.Rxd8 wining the b pawn, but I will play Bf3 as for now the threat Qf2-Qxg2++ is sufficient to prevent it
moves.24... Bf3: a new trap gxf3 Qxf3++, and the threat Bxe2 to Qxf4
moves.25... Rxb2: conscientiously leaving the back rank week to deflect the d rook
moves.26. Bh7+ Kf8: only move Kh8 is mate after Rxd8++, now if Rxd8+ Ke7 leaves three white pieces en prise the queen the knight and the rook
moves.27. Rxd8+ Ke7 28. Qa4: White's threat of Qd7++ lacks one tempo
moves.28... Qg1+: a nice sacrifice, to finish, to deflect the knight from the 2nd rank and achieve Bxg2++ a smothered mate with a bishop!
moves.29. Nxg1 Bxg2#: A nice finish to a nice game, during the game some inaccuracies from white allowed black to achieve a two pawn advantage and create a strong passed pawn, that focalized white's defensive efforts, and abled black to develop an attack on the king.
